website_summaries.verdict: A multifunctional shoe that performs well on the trail as it is on urban streets, the Meindl Respond GTX anthracite has impressed hundreds of users for its "out-of-the-box" comfort, solid build, and amazing support. It features a waterproof membrane too, which offers plenty of protection against rain or water. More importantly, it's very supportive, which made avid hikers and outdoor nazis become even more in love with the Respond GTX.It has a pretty stiff outsole that is designed to protect the foot against really hard surfaces. Wearing a padded insole can make walking on soft soil or grass much more comfortable.
pros: Tons of Meindl Respond GTX reviews say that this low-cut hiker is super comfortable right out of the box
It gets lots of praise for its top-notch construction
All thanks to the mesh upper, many people mention that it's quite breathable despite being a Gore-Tex shoe
The Respond GTX gets overwhelming five-star reviews for being very supportive
It's a footwear choice by many people with weak ankles and foot pain problems
Several users love that it's a wide-fitting hiking shoe, which means more room for comfort
A handful of avid hikers give this Meindl offering high ratings for its solid grip
cons: A few customers feel that the Meindl Respond GTX could use a little more padding
Some people also wish this shoe comes in different color options
A handful of wearers find its toe box to b slightly restrictive

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd Pair of Meindls
customer_reviews.text: Just got these to replace a pair of Meindl shoes that have finally after some 6? years started to leak. I also have some lovely Meindl Boots. Both these previous Meindls the most comfortable I have owned, fit my rather wide foot perfectly. Doubt I will look elsewhere in the future. These new ones look to be the same quality; Just waterproofed them and looking forward to using them first thing tomorrow morning.
customer_reviews.author: Richard46

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant if you have wide feet and bio mechanical feet problems.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes, these are my second pair. I have problems with my feet and require orthopaedic inserts and a shoe which gives good support. Meindl were recommended by the guy who made the inserts and they are made in a wide fitting size. They are a cut above everything I have tried and when these wear out, then I will order another pair.
customer_reviews.author: karl bone

customer_reviews.title: Top quality lightweight walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are to the expected Meindl standard: well designed and made. They are comfortable straight from the box. I bought them for ‘tramping about’: I do about 40 miles a week on town footpaths and country paths. (Mountain boots for the hills and mountains!) The shoes feel very steady and supportive, even over roughish ground. They are remarkably light in weight for a quality shoe. I have to use orthotic insoles: they fit a treat in these shoes. I particularly like the laces: they stay tied with just one bow, there’s no need for a double bow and lots of spare lace flapping about. An excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: C J Eccles

customer_reviews.title: Poor width fitting, insufficient sole cushioning, poor breathing.
customer_reviews.text: Considering the good reviews and the price of these shoes I am disappointed with them and expected more. While the length fit of the shoe is correct, even after 2 weeks wearing them these shoes are reluctant spread and accommodate my wide foot, unlike the Merrill shoes I am used to. In addition the sole has limited cushioning compared with other shoes, making them uncomfortable to ware for long periods. And finally they don't breath, so very warm feet. In summary, poor width fitting, insufficient sole cushioning, poor breathing. Won't be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: The shoes appear well-finished and are reasonably comfortable for short and medium length walks (up to about 5 miles). While some reviewers report it as having a wide fit, this was not my experience; it seems, at best, a standard fit. The main problem, and the reason that I have awarded just two stars, is that the waterproofing is ineffective; for a hiking shoe this is just unacceptable. I paid £103 for the shoes and the price has risen as high as £135 which is far too expensive and I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Emjay Ell

customer_reviews.title: Almost the perfect walking boot
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these walking boots, having purchased the first pair 6 years ago and are now relegated to gardening boots. Very comfortable and good for general hill walking every day with the dog. Waterproofing has always done its job. It was a pleasant surprise to find that Meindl still made this model!
customer_reviews.author: Mr G.

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I walk about 60 miles a week to and from work, and every time my Meindl Responds wear out, I just replace them, no questions asked. Superbly comfortable, supportive, perfectly fine-looking (aesthetics aren’t too of the priority list in walking shoes anyway but these look fine). I really love them.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and waterproof. An excellent buy once again.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Shoe which I have worn for the past 11 years (probably 2 pairs per year) as I walk a lot on tarmac. Alastair Wilson (Author) SANTIAGO ON TWO FEET.
customer_reviews.author: Alastair Wilson (Author) Santiago On Two Feet

customer_reviews.title: Serious walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is now my second having walked through Europe with the last pair, which are still comfortable but showing some signs of wear. The most comfortable waterproof shoes for the serious low level walker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, comfortable and xac
customer_reviews.text: I've done two day walks in the countryside with my new Meindl walking shoes, and I couldn't be happier. Both days were dry and it was dry underfoot, so they haven't been tested in wet or muddy conditions, but I'm confident they'll come up trumps. To my inexpert eye, the shoes seem very well made. They are certainly very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Izzard

customer_reviews.title: Fit for purpose
customer_reviews.text: These were a replacement buy. Meindl are excellent value, comfortable and stylish. They are good for walking and relatively sturdy. No complaints at all
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Bulow

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: Lovely fit, durable construction and they seem to handle well in rain and muddy terrain so far. Haven't had the chance to test on snow/ice, but the results so far are promising. The shoes are comfortable, especially for people like me with wider feet - I ordered a size 12 UK and the fit was as expected. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Grippy, weather proof , warm walking shoe .
customer_reviews.text: These last me 2-3 years , take them on my ski holidays and wear to the plot. - good grip in the wet and on slippery , icy slopes.
customer_reviews.author: spydermanbruce

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I always buy these shoes - so far I haven't found any others that fit as well
customer_reviews.author: relfte

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Duplicate of previous purchase of most comfortable walking shoes- ever
customer_reviews.author: DC Southward

customer_reviews.title: Well made product. Lives up to the Meindl reputation
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Comfortable and supportive. Had a number of pairs of this design now.Haven’t found anything I like better- despite looking!
customer_reviews.author: A CHARLTON

customer_reviews.title: Great quality really wears well
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair they feel great on the foot and last well.
customer_reviews.author: John Bishop

customer_reviews.title: A great walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent walking shoe which is really comfortable. Give a nice spring to your step and is really light.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Hockings

customer_reviews.title: Re- purchase
customer_reviews.text: After three years of continuous use the previous pair wore out - no point in looking for an alternative
customer_reviews.author: RAZECOMMENTS

customer_reviews.title: Well cushioned soles, and perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: For everyday walking around the district the shoes couldn't be bettered. Everything I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Vicinal

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit for me. This is the second pair I have bought. The first pair were great
customer_reviews.author: Keith Stamp

customer_reviews.title: Foot perfect
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and comfort Sizing was the same as my walking boots of this brand
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ian Blyth

customer_reviews.title: Meindle shoes
customer_reviews.text: Always wear Meindl shoes they do the job for me.
customer_reviews.author: MR R  QUARRIE

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of shoes. Have been wearing them for a few months now and I have covered a lot of miles on different terrain. This is my second pair as my first pair wore out after four years of happy walking. Even though the shoe design has altered slightly I must say these feel even more comfortable than the first pair. I have not had one blister from the first or second pair so I would highly recommend these shoes to anyone who does a serious amount of walking.
customer_reviews.author: M Colwell

customer_reviews.title: Meindl Respond Men's GTX
customer_reviews.text: These are my 3rd or 4th pair of Meindl Trainers and I think they are very comfortable. These particular ones are meant for jogging over rough terrain so they feel a bit hard but they are still comfortable for just getting from A to B.
customer_reviews.author: N. McCandless

customer_reviews.title: light walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes but not as comfortable as my Merrell shoes? maybe improve with time? But Merrell were comfortable from day one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Class Product
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant walking shoes. Extremely Comfortable. With proper walking so ks you wouldn't even know you had them on. Best shoes ever. Only using them on the roads so far.
customer_reviews.author: gerard o connor

customer_reviews.title: they have been pretty shabby for about year
customer_reviews.text: Just checking prices for my third pair. The ones I'm wearing are right royally knackered, they have walked Spain, Portugal, France, Italy, Germany, Luxembourg, Holland and all over the UK, 4.5 years, they have been pretty shabby for about year, but they fit like a glove and it's so hard to part with them (last big walk on the Quantocks last weekend). The sole of the midsole has finally given up and peeled away, and I got wet foot a week or two ago. They have seen their last winter. I can't recommend these shoe's enough. That is all.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. Finch

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am wearing my third pair. Comfort superb. Support good. Soles not too slippy. Critical comments: The soles have worn out faster than my previous Scarpa or Salomon shoes and I have needed to reproof with Nikwax eventually. But despite that, next year I will be buying my fouth pair. Each pair lasts about two to three years of about 15 miles per week. PS: I have plantar fascia problems and wear Yoursole heat mouldable insoles instead or the originals, which increases the arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Do not last long
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoes, but very poor durability. Have had mine less that 10 months and the soles are falling off in pieces. Also the toe section has detached. Expected better construction and a longer lifespan for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: B Roxburgh

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a pair of Merrell GTX approach shoe a few weeks ago but was entirely dissatisfied by them. Then I tried these Meindl Respond. They are really comfortable. I'm delighted.
customer_reviews.author: Dubai Tyke

customer_reviews.title: Took them out for a rainy walk this morning on sand with a small amount of standing water in shallow puddles and might as well h
customer_reviews.text: Have owned a pair for about a year. Only light usage on trails. Took them out for a rainy walk this morning on sand with a small amount of standing water in shallow puddles and might as well have been wearing regular trainers as they soaked up the water like sponges. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

product_meta.title: Meindl Men's Respond GTX Low Rise Hiking Shoes
product_meta.description: The Meindl Respond GTX menÃÂ€Âs walking shoe is the ideal choice for the everyday adventurer, perfect for walking, cycling and trail running. Made of velour leather and mesh construction with a GORE-TEXÃ‚Â membrane for a durable, waterproof performance on the trail. - GORE-TEXÃ‚Â membrane waterproof protection - Velour leather and mesh upper -Contagrip sole unit - Cupped heel stabiliser - Toe protector - Air-Active footbed offers shock absorption and optimum moisture transfer
feature_bullets: Contragrip Trail sole provides non slip stability and traction
